intro: Scabiosa achaeta, commonly known as the common scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its pink or purple flower heads that resemble small, rounded clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, oval-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Scabiosa achaeta is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
